question:
Which among the following are the conditions of becoming an urban area prescribed by the census of India?
1. All places with a municipality, corporation, cantonment board
2. A minimum population of not less than 5,000
3. Involvement of at least 75% of the male population in non-agricultural work
4. Minimum population density of 400 persons per sq. km
Choose the correct option from the codes given below :
explanation: The criteria of becoming an urban area prescribed by the census of India- All places with a municipality, corporation, cantonment board. A minimum population of not less than 5,000. Involvement of at least 75% of the male population in non-agricultural work. Minimum population density of 400 persons per sq. km.
